name: The Willard Street Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to The Willard Inn for a short stay in Burlington. I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and they were all right! We stayed in Lindsay's Loft (#15). It is a smallish room on the third floor, but very comfortable with plenty of light and your own private bathroom. The shower was very small, but was fine. The house itself is gorgeous and I loved the gardens out back. We were able to walk into town for dinner/activities during our stay. We got great advice on hikes in the area and were given helpful maps. I would highly recommend this place to any of my friends!
reviews.title: An Amazing Oasis

reviews.text: I could not have asked for a more enjoyable experience than we had during our brief stay at the Willard Street Inn!! I would HIGHLY recommend staying here if you are going to be in the Burlington area. We stayed in Lindsey's Loft room, which was clean, comfortable, and plenty spacious for the one evening we were able to spend there. Breakfast in the spacious, well lit dining area overlooking a beautiful garden in the back was a highlight. And the food was top notch! We are already planning a trip back soon.
reviews.title: Perfect start to our July 4th trip!!

reviews.text: I have tried in the past to get our family into The Willard Street Inn with no luck. Either they were full or we only needed a room/rooms for one night. (The Inn has a 2 night minimum.) I was so excited to finally be able to book the last room The Larkin Suite (Room 10) for my husband, daughter and myself during the very busy 3rd/4th of July holiday. After a long drive we were warmly welcomed and given a quick tour of the downstairs and explained the breakfast seatings. A dining room with coffee, tea, lemonade and cookies was available to help yourself. A downstairs refrigerator was available for guests to store food/drinks or refreeze ice packs for picnics or on the road snacks/meals. It was a spacious (well air conditioned) king bedded suite with a conjoined sitting room and comfy daybed. A small flat screen TV was in the sitting room for my daughter to enjoy, while my husband and I enjoyed relaxing on the super comfy bed with wireless service for our laptops. (There is also a public computer available on the first floor.)The bathroom was quirky yet charming with a slipper tub and small shower. Towels plushy and robes befitting a high end spa. An added bonus was that the city of Burlington celebrates the holiday with fireworks on the 3rd of July on Lake Champlain. We were too exhausted from traveling all day to attend the fireworks, but were able to enjoy them from the air conditioned comfort our room. It's a relatively quiet street so we all had a great nights sleep. We loved the red, white and blue waffles served with fresh fruit 4th of July morning. 2 other options were available, in addition to coffee, juice and a basket of breads and muffins. Took a picnic lunch to North Beach and decided after 3 hours the hotel/room was a much more comfortable option to relax. The Inn is situated within walking distance to a variety of wonderful restaurants. Our other daughter just moved off campus from UVM and the inn is also within walking distance to her apt. Looking forward to returning to the Willard Street Inn in the near future and highly reccommend this inn to all.
reviews.title: FAMILY FUN OVER THE FOURTH OF JULY HOLIDAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent 3 days at The Willard Street Inn! The grounds are amazing, the house is gorgeous, the solarium for breakfast is beautiful and the rooms are lovely as well. My husband and I were not at all impressed with the breakfast, however, which was a bummer. We tried each different kind: eggs/savory, sweet (pancakes, waffles, french toast), and their yogurt and granola. The eggs were not prepared well, the granola was much too sweet and the others were just okay. We were also surprised by the showers in the rooms-- gorgeous old rooms with impecable detail and that perfect country feel, but with plastic showers... seemed quite out of place. I think it would be a great investment to put in nicer showers with tile. We stayed in Rose Garden (a room on the third floor) one of the nights and the shower was TINY. I am 5 feet tall and thin and it was hard to move around that shower stall even for me! I can't imagine what it would be like for an average sized american.
reviews.title: Gorgeous stay, wonderful service, mediocre breakfast, not great showers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, our stay was really great and the service was wonderful... just a few things that I think could be improved upon.
reviews.title: Such a beautiful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestled in the midst of a small college, this inn was quite the respite. We booked the Woodhouse Suite (room #8) which had a queen bed, love seat, nook with two chairs and a table. Since this room was a corner room, we had a great view of the beautiful garden in the back, and plenty of windows to make it a bright, cheery room. We were on the second of the three floors (note: there is no elevator). We were within walking distance of Church Street, a pedestrian-only area where there are many shops and restaurants (see my review of Leunig’s Bistro – very average!)
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a quick tour upon arrival – the solarium is where breakfast would be served (you need to sign up for a time; only 4 rooms can sign up at a time for 8:00, 8:30, 9:00 and 9:30). Lemonade and cookies were available in the afternoon and the hot beverage area was available 24 hours. Guests also have use of a refrigerator and microwave in the kitchen. The free wi-fi was pretty fast. The information book in the room is very informative, listing local restaurants, shops, museums, parks, etc. within walking distance and a short drive, instructions on how to use the ceiling fan, tv, fireplace and A/C. Our room had a shower for two and each had a double shower head. The only con was that we ran out of hot water.
reviews.title: Elegant, Romantic, Peaceful, Refined...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was absolutely delicious – it changes daily but we had fantastic French Toast with Vermont Maple Syrup (served cold which was interesting) and fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Amazing stay - number one for a reason

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely a great place to stay in this area!
reviews.title: Lives up to its rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These are just a few of the many adjectives that come to mind when recalling the Willard Street Inn. The mansion's impressive facade and opulent interior furnishing are remarkable on their own, but it is the owner's hospitality and attention to detail that make the Inn a truly wonderful establishment. For instance, my partner and I were welcomed with freshly baked cookies and fresh squeezed lemonade. There were adorning flowers and plants in the common areas. For rainy days, there were books, magazines and boardgames laying around the many common sitting areas, I did not have a chance to explore the gorgeous garden, but I am sure I would have discovered even more beauty! This is a must-see and a must-go-back.
reviews.title: This Place is Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at 4 of the top rated b&bs in Burlington and Willard street Inn is a step above all others.
reviews.title: Best in Burlington
This is a great Bed and breakfast
reviews.text: The rooms are beautifully appointed, extremely clean with fresh clean bedding. Breakfast is fantastic and made with fresh locally made products. I would stay her every time I cme to Burlington if possible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first try at a bed and breakfast ever and my wife and I very very happy. This was a start to our vacation. This is 5 star. Period
reviews.title: Much more than a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful old mansion that was made into a B&B -- a very upscale B&B.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: large and well appointed rooms with lots of charm; an excellent breakfast in a bright and beautiful setting; the possibility to snack all day on home-baked delicacies if that is what you want to do; friendly and well-informed inn-keepers; a welcoming atmosphere; a charming setting; menus of the restaurants in the area are available; road trip suggestions are also available. I'm sure that in summer the gardens are superb. All the rooms look fantastic.
reviews.title: Stately yet cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and were very pleased with everything. We booked the Rose Room and liked how spacious it was. Most of all the cleanliness level was astonishing. This is not a modern building but nothing felt grimy or dirty. The fresh baked cookies near the entrance downstairs, as well as, the ones in our room with dried fruit were a nice touch. The surrounding grounds and their garden are also lovely. Breakfast was ample and good (and included things from their garden) but my dish - a frittata - could have used an extra something. I wouldn't want to give the idea that it was bad just that it was a little dry. I would highly recommend staying here, it is an experience in itself.
reviews.title: More than Worth It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great B&B with a great staff. This Inn is a very classic mansion for this area and has a wonderful garden. You can walk to Church Street and many stores and restaurants. Our room was tastefully done and comfortable. Met the owners in the parking lot and they told us of discounted tickets for the Shelburne Museum which were $5 off the admission price. The breakfasts served here are really fantastic. You have 3 choices each day which you make a seating time reservation the previous night. This works well. I'd stay here again and recommend this B&B to my friends.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stopped here on our way to Quebec. What a beautiful B&B. The room, staff, and food were all really great. And the location was perfect. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here with my family for 1 night on the 4th of July. Lovely quiet location, large B 7 B with many homey touches. The Inn has alot of information for the area, and the innkeepers more than willing to share information and give advice. The rooms were on the smallish side, old house smell noticeable in some (for those with allergies), but certainly not overwhelming or disturbing. I found the greeting to be friendly and helpful, the rooms clean, fresh lemonade and cookies a nice added touch, and the grounds quiet and extremly well kept. I enjoyed the breakfast, as did my family. The solarium is a wonderful room for breakfast, open and bright. Some of these rooms are on the 3rd floor - keep in mind to ask when reserving if you have trouble navigating alot of stairs. 2 of our rooms were on the third floor. The rooms were bright but small, with very small bathrooms (especially the shower). There is wifi at this Inn, a nice addition, as well as coffee and tea service 24 hours. Very close to the downtown area, parking right in front and plentiful. I really like Burlington, and will definitely choose this place again next time I find myself in this beuatiful spot of New England.
reviews.title: Very pleasant brief respite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i just stayed in Room #10 (Suite Larkin) for 2 nights and I highly recommend this inn. Once we parked our car, we didn't get in it again for almost 48 hours! The inn is conveniently located to downtown Burlington and the waterfront. We strolled down to the Church Street Marketplace area for dinner each night (Leunigs one night and the Farm House the next). We rented bikes at Local Motion on the bike path which we highly recommend. during the four hour rental, we biked most of the bike path, heading out to the causeway, then completed most of the "City Path" which surprisingly and pleasantly took us through the woods (in Ethan Allen Park) and through beautiful fields before coming into the UVM campus. We locked them up downtown and had a wonderful lunch of beer and pizza at American Flatbread. The inn was extremely quiet and our room was HUGE. The breakfasts each morning were filling and yummy - there was a choice of three dishes each morning. This is not a B&B where you ever see the owners (at least we didn't), but that didn't detract from our stay.
reviews.title: Great all-around B&B in Burlington

description: The Willard Street Inn is a historic 1881, Victorian mansion nestled within Burlington, Vermont's picturesque hill district. Offering 14-individually appointed rooms with private baths, views of Lake Champlain & Adirondacks, English Gardens, free Wi-Fi, and gourmet breakfasts in our marble-floored solarium. Walkable to downtown, waterfront, colleges. Come experience the service of yesteryear with the amenities of today.
